projectDesc.p: "Now the depths of my heart is published by The Global Medieval Sourcebook (GMS), a free, open access, and open source compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. GMS comprises computer-readable transcriptions or editions alongside new translations of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. The GMS platform includes critical introductions as well as sources for further reading.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern American English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Scribal errors and creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.
Linebreaks and punctuation follow the manuscript.

app.lem: Yetz schaydens wee ist worden kund / meins hertzen grund /
app.rdg: Now the depths of my heart have discovered separation’s sorrow,

app.lem: des ich vor nye / dan erst durch dye / bin worden inn / hertz mut und synn /
app.rdg: my heart, spirit and senses, which I have only experienced because of her,

app.lem: ward mir zerstrayt / gantz weit und prayt /
ich dacht ich stürb vor hertyenlayd.
app.rdg: I thought I’d die of a broken heart.

app.lem: Nun hat sich glück herwider kert /
und mich ernert / vor schaydens pein /
app.rdg: and saved me from separation’s pain,

app.lem: dardurch al mein / plut was betrübt /
app.rdg: through which all my blood was dulled.

app.lem: glück hat geübt / in disem spil /
app.rdg: Fortune has played its part in this game,

app.lem: darin ich vil / frewd lust und gnad erwerben wil.
app.rdg: in which I will gain much joy, pleasure and favor.

app.lem: Sölch frewd ytz niemer widerfart / ist mir gar hart /
app.rdg: Now it’s very hard for me that such joy is gone forever.

app.lem: verkert in laid ich wider schayd /
app.rdg: Turned to pain, I leave again;

app.lem: macht newes wee / noch mer dan ee /
app.rdg: this brings new sorrow, even greater than before:

app.lem: mein hertz erkant / recht lieb befandt /
app.rdg: my heart had come to know and had felt joy:

app.lem: erst thut mir schayden angstlich andt.
app.rdg: only now separation brings me to despair.
